meanings.sent1: When his brother broke his favorite toy, it enrages him.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment enrages her every time.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to eat the new food enrages the dog, who thinks it's a game.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise from the construction site enrages the neighbors like a never-ending drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal by his closest friend enrages him to the core.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become enraged.
meanings.sent1: The rude comments from the audience enrages the performer.
meanings.sent2: The news of the robbery enrages the entire community.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning printer enrages the office manager, leading to a comical outburst.
meanings.sent4: The sight of litter on the beach enrages her, as if the ocean itself was offended.
meanings.sent5: The sight of injustice enrages him like a fire burning inside.
